name: Kelly McCabe
text: Fast service, delicious pizza for a good price. Not many topping options which is okay for me since I love cheese. The wait staff is young but very nice, friendly and efficient. The calzone is huge! …More

name: Karthik Raja
text:
Coalfire in Chicago is my favorite so was hoping this  place in the suburbs might come close.
A good pizza starts with great dough and fermenting process and then cooked to …More

name: Joshua Taggart
text: Loved everything we ate here! We had the hand rolled meatballs with ricotta cheese and a 16" pizza that was half Philly cheese steak and half crosstown classic. The coal fired aspect is unique and helps this pizza place stand out amongst a …More

name: Lisa Scher
text: Love their pizza! We have frequented their location near Pompano Beach and loved it. So happy to have a location a tad closer to home. Their wings are so good!! And of course,  their main feature pizza. Love just a cheese pizza with the blobs of sauce on top!!

name: Will Rockwell
text: Good pizza, limited topping options, friendly staff, nice clean restaurant

name: Brendan O'Connor
text: This place has absolutely fantastic. Erica, the manager, is an expert in hospitality and absolutely crushed our last minute requests for a table of 10. Her, along with her staff, were so kind, patient, and funny during our dinner. The pizza is fantastic and I would recommend this to anyone. Probably the best pizza in the area.

name: Jacinta Cruz
text:
The restaurant is very nice and has a good vibe. The staff is nice and helpful. The Menu has not a lot of options but they are enough.
Inside the restaurant exists a very good bar with good cocktails options. …More

name: Mark M
text: I have placed the order around 1pm for 630pm pick up. At about the pick up time I'd go there and........ my order wasn't ready, i was forced to wait for 45minutes, standing like an idiot, because my order wasn't simply ready. None of the …More

name: Monica Del Angel
text: Hubby and I just stopped in for Saturday night pizza and drinks.  Was seated and sat...for 10 minutes with only a busboy coming over to drop off plates and say "enjoy"! 6 waiters and 3 cooks behind counter but no one else made eye contact or offered to take our orders! Zero stars is more appropriate.  Very disappointed

name: Joe Aiello
text: Sat forever and the place wasn't busy. It was a Friday night and I server came by with water - took our drink order and never returned. Had to get another server's attention and finally got drinks. Had to get our food to go - which was a …More

name: Heath Schecter
text: asked what we wanted to drink as we were just sitting down. daughter spilled water, we had to get towels, nobody helped. pizzas are way over priced, dough over worked because way too much chew, not very tender. side salad for daughter over …More

name: Debbie Caragiulo
text: This place rocks.  We had their traditional chicken wings with caramelized onions and extra crispy sausage and mushroom pizza!!!  Loved!

name: Kirsten Duenas
text: Had the prosciutto and arugula pizza so good! Coal fired wings were delicious too. Excellent menu, can't wait to come back and try more things! Super friendly and attentive staff too.

name: Carolynne Ferrara
text:
Ordered take out. Small pizza and 5 wings. Very good!
Friendly service from the manager Erica.
Will be back! :)

name: Victor Wierzba
text: This review is not based on the food because our party didn't get the opportunity to try it. We were seated during a non busy time (3 or 4 other tables). We were given menus and waited for about 10-15 mins. Several employees passed us to …More

name: Lucian Slatineanu
text: One of the few places that does coal pizzas with that authentic Italian taste. Awesome for a quick bite.

name: J J
text: Great pizza. Fast service and reasonable prices. Better than MOD next door hands down!

name: George Diskos
text: Overprice for mediocre pizza. Slow service. I am not sure about the other reviews but I have to disagree. Last night 5 wings 2 drinks $29 plus tip $38. 3 nights ago bottle off meome wine 2 cocktails 2 apps 2 soups 1 salad and 1 large pizza $150??? No thanks. Atmosphere is nice.

name: Carlos Gumaya
text: First time trying this place. Very dissatisfied. Have to wait for at least 40 minutes for our order to be served. And it was not hot, seems like it was sitting somewhere for quite a while. The food wasn't that great either. The servers are more attentive to the people at the bar. Not coming back.

name: Theresa Jacobsen
text: Def holds up to its claim!  I'm from NJ so a very picky pizza gal... but the pizza here was delicious!  Def taste the quality in the ingredients.  Highly recommend.

name: Samantha Salinas
text: Delicious wood fired pizza. Went during lunch and had the pie special, arugula and prosciutto.  Only disappointment was they were out of every beer we tried to order.

name: Filip Slavov
text: Food and desert were great but the drinks are small and expensive....

name: kathy milas
text: Awesome pizza and meatballs are a must try. Great service.

name: Michael Sobel
text: The pizza was really good,  never had meatball and ricotta pizza before.  It was great and filled with miniature meatballs. They even gave us a sample of the baked wings with caramelized onions.  Yum!!

name: Brian Shelton
text: Nice looking place and menu.  There were two other tables occupied when we came in at 1pm.  We ordered two lunch size pizzas and waited 45 minutes.

name: Michael Russo
text: Pizza is really good. Order the pizza well done for the best experience.

name: Melanie Perez
text: Food was incredible. We started with mozerella and tomatoes with vinegar and oil drizzle, the oven baked wings with caramelized onion that were falling of the bone.  No rub or sauce needed. Pizza was done within 10 minutes of appetizer …More

name: Brundon Majors
text: I used to say great things about this place fequent thier Florida location. This location in Kildeer though is not so great. Service is extremely slow, the pizza lacks sauce and is nothing like the Florida locations which came long before this one. Basically probably the last time I go here, unless I'm in Florida.

name: Christian Szabo
text: Good pizza but overpriced, more room dedicated to cooking, prep, and bar then tables, not sure what idiot did layout.  Need reservations to get a table otherwise you are stuck at bad or pizza theater or whatever they call it.

name: Bill Dekoning
text: I've always loved pizza! Eat it once a week. Recently returned from 2 weeks in Italy. Still have my favorite place to go, but looking for and craving that real Napolitano pizza. Tried a few places, but just tried Anthony's coal fired pizza, …More

name: Carla Giandonato
text:
Love the coal fire pizza
Such a different approach us Chicagoans are used to deep dish this is definitely different …More

name: APG
text: Service was good.Pizza was ok , there wings for appetizer are not recommended.

name: Anthony Labalestra
text: I came here last night with my wife and family that is here from Italy (Mola di Bari). We took them here because this is honestly one of the best pizzas you'll find anywhere in the NW burbs. It is the closest to authentic Italian pizza …More

name: Alyssa Niedzwiedz
text: Went for dinner with a party of four. Would have been better off ordering dominos. We waited 40 min for a server to take our order on a weekday evening. The menu prices seemed fair until the server questioned our orderin and said we were …More

name: Nick Hindman
text: Pizza was good but prices are outrageous.   We will not be coming back.

name: Richard Berry
text: The place is still running through some new opening pains but it has some really good pizza and great options for everyone. It's a bit slow for going for lunch hour but it does have good options if you have the time.

name: Frederick Schiffley
text: Love the pizza, salad, and wings. Staff awesome as well.

name: Robert Zuniga
text: Their huge sign outside of the building says "you have to try our pizza!" So I did and found it less tastier than other pizza places I have tried.

name: Joanna Izurieta
text: I give them 4 stars because when I took out take out pizza it wasn't the best it was cold and everything was pretty much smash together but we actually when in the restuarnt for one last try and my husband and i tried out the pizza and it …More

name: Romeo Explosion
text: We were so excited to try this place. Unfortunately this was the greasiest pizza I have have ever had. It was inedible. It literally fell apart as we were eating it.

name: rina soni
text: Arugula pie one of the best. Good service!!!

name: Patrick Cappelletti
text: Great pizza and wings.. good people.

name: George Laegeler
text: Pizza was great. Service was great also

name: Aggie Fullerton
text: Great pizza!!!! Awedome atmosphere

name: Mike Frazier
text: First time having coal fired pizza and it was great!!

name: Anthony Cassidy
text: Great food, waitress wasn’t great.

name: Ryan Freund
text: Good. Expensive.  Slow.

name: Ptown.branchy10 DAD
text: Very expensive and terrible pizza.

name: David Robert
text: MOD is better!

name: Lisa Barnes
text: Great pizza!

name: Sam Makhlouf
text: Great pizza!

text: Bad wings
